API Documentation¶

File-IO¶

file_io.create_files(filepath, endata, expxdata, potdata, wfdata)¶

Creates files containing the energies (energies.dat), expected values for x and thier uncertainities (expvalues.dat), the potentials and their corresponding x-values (potential.dat) and the eigenstates with their corresponding x_values (wavefuncs.dat)

Parameters:
  • filepath – Filepath of the destination, in which the files should be
  • saved –
  • endata – array containing data dedicated to energies.dat
  • expxdata – array containing data dedicated to expvalues.dat
  • potdata – array containing data dedicated to potential.dat
  • wfdata – array containing data dedicated to wavefuncs.dat
file_io.read_data(directory, fname)¶

Read a file and extract the contant as an array.

Parameters:
  • directory – Directory which contains the file.
  • Name of the file. (fname.) –
Returns:

Array of content.
file_io.read_files(filepath)¶

reads four different files and converts them into arrays

Parameters:
  • filepath – Filepath of , energies.dat, expvalues.dat, `potential.dat
  • wavefuncs.dat (and) –
Returns:

array containing energies of their corresponding eigenstates expxdata: array containing expected values for x and their uncerainnities potdata: array containing potentials and corresponding x-values wfdata: array containing eigenstates and corresponding x-values
Return type:

endata
file_io.read_schrodinger(directory, file)¶

Reads the file “schrodinger.inp” containing special formated user data describing the problem

Parameters:filepath – Filepath of “schrodinger.inp”
Returns:Dictionary containing the needed data for further calculations
Return type:alldata
file_io.write_result(directory, fname, array)¶

Write an array in a file.

Parameters:
  • directory – Directory where to write the file.
  • fname – Name of the file.
  • array – Array to write into fname.

Calculations¶

Module which contains all functions for numerical calculations.

calc.expected_values(xplot, EVEC, minEV, maxEV)¶

Calculates the expected value of the position.

Parameters:
  • xplot – x values.
  • EVEC – Array of the eigenvectors to calculate the expected position of.
  • minEV – Lower bound of the eigenvalues.
  • maxEV – Upper bound of the eigenvalues.
Returns:

Array containing the expected values of the position.
Return type:

expectedx
calc.get_WF_array(xplot, minEV, maxEV, evec)¶

Calculating the Array of the wavefunctions in the

x1 Psi1(x1) Psi2(x1)

x2 Psi1(x2) Psi2(x2)

format.

Parameters:
  • xplot – Array of the x values.
  • minEV – Lower bound of eigenvalues.
  • maxEV – Upper bound of eigenvalues.
  • evec – Array of the eigenvectors.
Returns:

Array with the described format.
Return type:

WF
calc.pot_calc(xplot, discrete_pot, interpoltype)¶

Interpolates the Potential for given data points.

Parameters:
  • xplot – Array of the x values.
  • pot – Array with the data points of the potential.
  • interpoltype – Type of the interpolation.
Returns:

Array with values of the potential at the points of xplot.
Return type:

VV

Visualization¶

This script visualizes the wavefunctions of a given potential.

visualizer.main()¶

Main function to show the plot of the potential, the eigenvalues, the wavefunctions, the expected values of the position of the particle. It reads out the data which were calculated by the solver.

visualizer.pot_plot(xmin, xmax, minEV, maxEV, EVAL, EVEC, pot, xplot, ydiff, expx, unc)¶

Creates a graphical plot. It shows the potential, the eigenvalues, the wavefunctions, the expected values of the position of the particle. And within a second plot it shows the uncertainty of the expected position.

Parameters:
  • xmin – Lower bound of the x values.
  • xmax – Upper bound of the x values.
  • minEV – Lower bound of the eigenvalues which should be visualized.
  • maxEV – Upper bound of the eigenvalues which should be visualized.
  • EVAL – Array of eigenvalues.
  • EVEC – Array containing the wavefunctions as column vectors.
  • pot – Interpolation of the potential at the xplot values.
  • xplot – Values were the potential is defined.
  • ydiff – Absolute difference between the lowest pot-value and the highest eigenvalue.
  • expx – Expected values of the position.
  • unc – Uncertainty of the position.
